title: Extinction Rebellion protesters disrupt cities in New Zealand and Australia – video
text: Climate protesters in Australia and New Zealand have blocked roads and entered banks and energy companies as part of Extinction Rebellion's planned week of action. Police in Sydney arrested 30 people when about 300 protesters blocked a road near the city centre. Videos uploaded to social media also showed arrests taking place in Brisbane. In Wellington, protesters staged a 'die-in' at an ANZ Bank and occupied the foyer of the Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment, while in Melbourne protesters banged on the doors of Energy Australia.
description: Climate protesters in Australia and New Zealand have blocked roads and entered banks and energy companies as part of Extinction Rebellion's planned week of action.
